ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned about my body and to appreciate it more. I also learned about West African dance culture.
I developed a greater appreciation for African music and culture
I learned to engage my body and learn something by repetition

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It's hard to take a dance class on zoom. That's all.
This class was very difficult over Zoom.
Dance practice was great and fun. The readings were sometimes dry and didn't even always make sense, and would be an absurd amount of pages.
Very nice very fun class! Never really brought me stress. Better communication about deadlines and expectations would be nice.
NA
Profesor is dedicated and commited to his students.
strength is the repetition

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Dance online is certainly not ideal... hopefully it's in person in the future because I totally recognize its challenges!
We were still able to learnt the dance moves through zoom, which was awesome.
great engagement virtually

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. It's a great class that expanded my perception of my placement in society and how I integrate my knowledge of art/expression in how I theorize about social cultures. Very well-rounded class.
Yes, it's a fun class... I never thought I would take a DANCE class, let alone at YALE!
Yes!
Yes! Fun class, great professor
Wholeheartedly yes. The professor takes your on a journey with your body through African dance.
YES!! TAKE THIS CLASS

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: none.
NA
